description:
We all know that Hollywood is trash as they obnoxiously and blatantly insert their woke propaganda in productions - to the point that nothing is watchable anymore. They were also one of the first businesses to force employees into getting the vaccine during the Panny D even before the federal government jumped on that bandwagon.

Employers should not be allowed to force employees to receive medical injections against their will - especially when that medication has no long-term studies and does nothing to prevent anything or anyone from getting what it claims to do. But because of how deranged Hollywood is, they thought differently. And now they should have to pay the price.

‚Äî (@)
title: ABC ordered to face trial over religious discrimination complaint on legendary soap opera

description:

The Chicago Board of Education voted unanimously on Thursday to remove school resource officers from Chicago Public Schools, with the removal of the of
title: Crime-ridden progressive city votes to remove police from public schools because, and I quote, "safety is a top priority"

description:
Race is an insignificant thing, especially compared to things like gender. Because of that, if people can change their gender all because they wake up with an ambiguous ‚Äúfeeling‚Äù that no one in existence can explain, then the logic serves that you should also be able to change your race. But the problem with that is that logical reasoning is not something that gets in the way of progressive priorities. And because of that, we have this story.

A trans-racial black man is suing the City of Chicago because he claims that as a Police officer, he has been discriminated against because of his race - to the point that he has missed out on promotions.

‚Äî (@)
title: Chicago police can change their gender, so now this cop is suing to change his race

description:
During busy times, like 2 am on New Year's Day, Uber and Lyft do this thing where they inflate prices as a reason to allegedly slow the demand and better serve the consumer. This has also been seen for things like concert tickets, movie prices, etc. But this is not typically something you see with fast food burgers. And all of a sudden, Wendy‚Äôs has decided to shoot itself in the foot and join the price surge bandwagon.

You read that correctly. Wendy‚Äôs announced that it intends to inflate prices during busy times for God knows what reason and all I have to say to this is that it is my unprofessional opinion that that is a bad marketing move.

‚Äî (@)
title: Wendy's has a new ABSURD way to make your Baconator more expensive when they're busy

description:
Hate speech is subjective, not an objective fact. And because of that, there really is no such thing as hate speech, as it is nothing more than an excuse for tyrants to silence people and censor phrases they don‚Äôt like. This is why our northernmost neighbors have decided to usher in laws that not only criminalize words they don‚Äôt like but also have penalties that can put someone in prison for life.

In other words, it is illegal to hate someone and that could land you in prison for the rest of your days.

‚Äî (@)
title: Federal government pushing new "hate speech" law that could land YOU in jail for life

description:

title: Watch: Crowder Called It! A Majority Of Americans Now Support Building The Wall

description:
I'll admit... I'm not voting for Joe Biden. He's been a horrible president, and that's without factoring in the senility, alleged dementia, and having a brain that is 69% tapioca pudding. But if you like Joe Biden and are trying to convince voters who are on the fence that he isn't the old coot he looks like, I can't imagine his visit to Seth Meyers last night will help.

Seth is a Democrat activist who hosts a progressive political podcast called "Late Night with Seth Meyers." The one softball he didn't lob at Joe was about polls and how many Americans believe he is too old to be president. Biden reassured their fears with a rambling answer that saw his train of thought go off the tracks and run over a squirrel.
title: Watch: Eldery man is rambling mess when asked about being too old to be POTUS... but at least he got ice cream!

description:
You gotta had it to the The View broads. The most trusted names in "news" for low-information suburbanites are still all in on the SCHMOVID lockdown narrative. Yes, even knowing what we know now about shutting down schools. Yes, even though it's been 1,427 + 15 days to flatten the curve. Dr. Phil gave them a harsh dose of reality on Monday's show.

In it, he criticizes the school lockdowns during SCMOVID (among other things). title: Watch: Dr. Phil puts the shrill harpies from "The View" in their place over school lockdowns, and the audience erupts
